fpmExplorer:Page.title: Custom KPI Tags in List Report

Text.text: You can add custom Key Performance Indicator (KPI) tags to your List Report application to display important metrics and data points.
You can use the KPITag building block as described here:

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: KPI Configuration in Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Define your custom KPI tags in the manifest.json file under the keyPerformanceIndicators section. Each KPI references a fragment template that defines its appearance and behavior.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Basic KPI Tag Fragment
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Create a fragment that defines a simple KPI tag with static values. The KPITag macro provides properties for number, unit, and status display.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Interactive KPI Tag with Press Handler
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: For interactive KPI tags, add a press handler that references a method in your controller extension. This allows users to click on the KPI for additional actions.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Controller Extension Configuration
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Register your controller extension in the manifest.json file to handle KPI press events and other custom logic.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Controller Implementation
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Implement the press handler method in your controller extension to define what happens when users interact with the KPI tags.
